passage:
(1) The relationship between geography and economic development has long fascinated economists and historians alike. Natural resources, climate conditions, and geographic location all play crucial roles in determining a region's economic trajectory. Countries with abundant natural resources such as oil, minerals, or fertile land often have significant economic advantages, though these advantages do not guarantee prosperity without proper management and infrastructure.

(2) Access to waterways has historically been a major driver of economic development. Coastal regions and areas near navigable rivers typically develop faster due to reduced transportation costs and increased trade opportunities. This pattern is evident in the concentration of major global cities along coastlines and waterways, from New York to Shanghai. Even in the modern era of air travel and digital communication, proximity to efficient transportation routes remains a significant economic asset.

(3) Climate also influences economic development patterns. Moderate climates tend to support higher agricultural productivity and lower infrastructure maintenance costs. Additionally, extreme climate conditions can impose substantial burdens on economic growth through increased healthcare expenses, reduced labor productivity, and higher construction costs. This climate effect partially explains why temperate zones have historically seen more consistent economic development than tropical or arctic regions.

(4) The distribution of natural resources across regions has led to specialized economic activities in different parts of the world. Middle Eastern countries have developed economies centered on oil extraction and refinement, while countries in South America often focus on agricultural production and mining. This specialization can create economic opportunities but also leaves regions vulnerable to resource depletion or price volatility in global markets.

(5) However, the relationship between geography and economic prosperity is not deterministic. Countries like Japan and Singapore have achieved remarkable economic success despite limited natural resources through investments in human capital, technology, and efficient governance systems. In the modern global economy, factors such as institutional quality, education levels, and technological innovation can sometimes outweigh geographic advantages or disadvantages, suggesting that while geography matters significantly, it is not destiny.

questions.question: Which form of the verb is correct? She _____ in this company since 2010.
Choose the correct relative pronoun: The book _____ I borrowed from the library was very interesting.
Select the correct conditional form: If it _____ tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.
Choose the correct passive voice form: The project _____ by the team last month.
Which sentence contains the correct article usage?

options.A: He is best student in class.
options.B: She plays the piano for an hour every day.
options.C: We went to a Europe last summer.

questions.question: Identify the correct preposition: The train is scheduled to arrive _____ 3 PM.
Select the correct modal verb: You _____ consult a doctor if the symptoms persist.
Choose the correct verb form: She suggested that he _____ a different approach.
Which sentence uses the correct comparative form?

options.A: This book is more better than the previous one.
options.B: Their house is more larger than ours.
options.C: The weather today is less warmer than yesterday.
options.D: This exercise is more challenging than I expected.

questions.question: Identify the correct conjunction: I wanted to attend the meeting, _____ I had a prior commitment.
Which sentence has the correct subject-verb agreement?

options.A: The number of participants were higher than expected.
options.B: Neither of the students have submitted their assignments.
options.D: The quality of these products has improved significantly.

questions.question: Select the correct past perfect form: By the time the rescue team arrived, the hikers _____ for six hours.
Choose the correct future continuous form: This time next week, we _____ on the beach in Hawaii.
Which sentence has the correct use of gerund?

options.A: I look forward to hear from you soon.
options.B: She enjoys to read novels in her free time.
options.D: We discussed about joining the club.

questions.question: Identify the correct reported speech: He said, 'I will call you tomorrow.'

options.A: He said that he will call me tomorrow.
options.B: He said that he would call me the next day.
options.C: He said that he will call me the following day.
options.D: He told that he would call me tomorrow.

options.D: The doctor will penalize the patient with vitamin supplements.

questions.question: Select the antonym for 'familiar':
According to paragraph 1, which of the following is NOT mentioned as a factor affecting economic development?
The passage suggests that coastal regions develop faster primarily because they:
Which statement best represents the author's view on climate and economic development?

options.A: Tropical regions have seen more consistent economic development.
options.B: Extreme climates impose burdens on economic growth.
options.C: Climate has no effect on economic development patterns.

questions.question: According to the passage, specialization in resource-based economies can:
The examples of Japan and Singapore in paragraph 5 are used to illustrate that:

options.A: Geographic advantages always determine economic success
options.B: Natural resources are the most important factor for development
options.C: Geography does not completely determine economic outcomes
options.D: Island nations have unique economic advantages

questions.question: The author's main purpose in writing this passage is to:

options.A: Argue that geographic location is the only factor that matters in economic development
options.B: Demonstrate that natural resources are essential for economic success
options.C: Explore the complex relationship between geography and economic development
options.D: Prove that geographic disadvantages cannot be overcome

questions.question: The phrase 'this pattern' in paragraph 2 refers to:

options.B: The faster development of coastal regions
options.D: The role of infrastructure in development

questions.question: The word 'deterministic' in paragraph 5 is closest in meaning to:
Which of the following factors does the passage suggest can sometimes outweigh geographic disadvantages?
The passage implies that the relationship between geography and economic prosperity is:

options.A: No longer relevant in the modern economy
options.B: Important but not the sole determining factor
